results.title: Two women = La Ciociara
results.creator_credit: Compagnia Cinematografica Champion Films Marceau, Cocinor, Societe Generale de Cinematographie, Carlo Ponti and Vittorio De Sica
results.brief_description: The story centers on a widow (Sophia Loren) who runs a tiny grocery store in Rome. When the store is bombed, she decides to return to her native village with her 13 year old daughter (Eleonora Brown). Back in her village, a timid schoolteacher (Jean-Paul Belmondo) falls in love with her. Her young daughter also secretly falls in love with him and becomes alienated from her mother because of it. While he is on a war mision, he is killed and the mother and daughter become friends once more and agree to carry on. They seek refuge in a church as they make they way back to Rome and encounter an event that will change their lives forever. Version dubbed in English. Adapted from a novel by Alberto Moravia.

results.title: Two women = Do zan [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Arman Film, Arta Film and Tahmineh Milani
results.brief_description: Two women, Fereshteh (Niki Karimi) and Roya (Marila Zare’i) become friends while studying at Tehran University. There’s a cloud of doubt over whether the university will stay open however, there’s rioting, and Fereshteh fears her future plans to become educated and enlightened will not eventuate. One day she is approached by a girl at university who wants to introduce her to Ahmad, a potential husband, she’s also being harassed by a man who follows her around campus and insists he is in love with her. One day the man sees her with her cousin and, believing him to be her lover, throws acid on him. Fereshteh is unfairly blamed for the incident and her father demands she leave university and return home. An unfortunate accident removes her harasser when he is sent to jail, but Fereshteh is held to blame also and is bailed out by Ahmad, her life and family honour indebted to him due to his financial assistance. Milani’s fifth film is an accomplished piece about a woman stifled in her attempt at liberation by a trinity involving her father, her husband, and a stranger. In Farsi with English subtitles.

results.title: Two weeks in Japan
results.brief_description: Travelogue showing various parts of Japan with its lovely landscapes, mountains and seas, teeming modern cities and quiet country villages, and its many unique festivals.

results.title: Two views on socialism
results.brief_description: Specially designed to stimulate an intellectual discussion on the difference between socialism and capitalism. The basic charges levelled by socialists against capitalistic society are made and answered.

results.title: Two trumpets for St Andrew
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission, Intertel and Gil Brealey
results.brief_description: Through the rivalry of two trumpeters representing brass bands of St Andrew’s Club and the Union Club, in Luga, Southern Malta, we are shown a picture of Maltese life, changing from its age-old religious conformities to meet with the demands of the 20th century, which is rapidly encroaching on its social and cultural customs.

results.title: Two towns: Gubbio in Italy, Chillicothe in Ohio
results.creator_credit: Learning Corporation of America, John H. Secondari and Helen Jean Secondari
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Comparative cultures and geography”
Explains that the towns of Gubbio in Italy and Chillicothe in southeastern Ohio are both agricultural centres of about 30,000 people. Describes the different value systems based on historical, cultural and geographical factors. Shows scenes of daily routines.

results.title: Two thousand women
results.creator_credit: Gainsborough Pictures, Edward Black and Frank Launder
results.brief_description: Phyllis Calvert, Patricia Roc and Flora Robson star in this vivid document of 1944: a time when women were finding a new independence, and women stars and audience were taken seriously by British cinema. This intense story of a prisoner of warcamp in occupied france, takes the classic formulas common to male prison camp drama and transforms them. The women stand up to the enemy, outwit their jailers, help inmates to escape without tears or hysteria. They are mutually supportive in the face of their privations and their story is told through a woman’s eyes rather than from the male perspective

results.title: Two thousand million years later
results.creator_credit: S S Waddington Productions, David Waddington and Ian Barry
results.brief_description: Outlines a holiday visit by a 12-year-old boy to his grandfather at Broken Hill. The grandfather, a retired miner, shows him the scope and method of underground mining carried out at Broken Hill. The holiday moves to the Western Australian operation of Hamersley Iron and later the northern Queensland operation of Mary Kathleen Uranium. We meet many people from these operations and see how they relax and enjoy themselves.

results.title: Two thirds sky (A)
results.creator_credit: Arcadia Pictures, SBS Independent, Sophie Jackson and Sean O'Brien
results.brief_description: This visually stunning documentary is an innovative portrait of the Australian desert as seen through the eyes of five contemporary Australian artists: Gloria Petyarre, Judy Watson, Peter Sharp, Jenny Sages and Idris Murphy. Following the creative journeys of the artists - both Indigenous and non-Indigenous - from blank canvas to finished painting, the film provides a fresh insight into the connections between art and place and our changing attitudes to Australia’s outback. Each artist has a different relationship to the land they paint yet all are attempting to express their identity and sense of belonging through their work. Beautiful visual imagery edited in a series of striking dissolves and fades, clearly demonstrates the relationships between the artists’ work and the land. Cinematography by Joel Peterson. Editing by Nick Meyers. Comprehensive teachers notes available at: http://www.filmaust.com.au/programs/teachers_notes/8607twothirdssky.pdf
